string-array.name: preference_immersive_mode_entries
string-array.item: Only hide on-screen virtual navigation buttons

resources.string: Auto-level will automatically rotate photos so that they appear level.\n\nNote that this means images will come out a slightly lower resolution (due to the rotation and cropping that\'s required).
Sorry, auto-level not supported\non this device
Failed to stamp info to photo

HDR mode is useful for shots with a large variation in brightness. It works by taking multiple shots at different exposures, and combining them to create the final image.

Note that HDR is not suitable for scenes with fast movement, and may result in less accurate colour reproduction.

Taking photos in HDR mode will be slower.

Touch to focus, and press the blue camera button to take photos. For more help, click Online help from Settings. Open Camera is completely free. If you like this app, please consider buying my donate app :) (see link in Settings, or Online help).\n\nPrivacy Policy: Location permission is required for geotagging, but this is disabled by default. If enabled, your location is encoded in the saved files (and it is only used for this purpose).
Camera permission is required to enable the camera
Location permission is required for geotagging
Microphone permission is required to record video with audio
Storage read/write permission is required to save photos
Highlight color for when camera is nearly level
Take photo or record video when a noise is detected, or on a voice command (\"cheese\"). When enabled, use the on-screen microphone button to start and stop listening.
Noise level sensitivity for audio (loud noise) option
Images will be rotated so they are automatically level (photos only) (slower to take photos, and may fail on devices with too low memory)
Whether to save photos on a background thread (for faster operation)
Delay (if any) between taking photos in burst mode

Please place your device on a flat horizontal surface so that it is level (either in portrait or landscape orientation), and then select Calibrate.

Press Reset to remove the calibration from your device.

Press back button to cancel.
This option calibrates your device\'s accelerometer, so the auto-level and on-screen level/angle options work correctly.
Enable this if your device has buggy flash behaviour with Camera2 API
Allows faster capture of the HDR/expo shots. Disable this if your device has problems when taking photos with HDR or Expo photo modes.
Applies the selected color effect to the photo

A crop guide displays a rectangle showing what the specified aspect ratio looks like - useful if you plan to crop the photo/video afterwards to a different aspect ratio. Requires WYSIWYG photo mode, or being in video mode.
If you like this app, please consider making a donation to support development. You can do this by purchasing my "donation app" - click this option to open up the page for my donation app. Thanks!
Number of images for exposure bracketing mode
How many stops to subtract/add for the darkest/brightest image
Set to 0 for the default exposure compensation
Use face detection instead of focus areas
Force 4K UHD video (only works on some devices)

Enable 3840x2160 resolution for video recording on back camera - this option is a hack that may allow 4K devices on 4K cameras that don\'t expose the option to 3rd party camera apps. This isn\'t guaranteed to work, please test before working.
Display the remaining device storage space on screen
Whether to mirror images when using the front camera.
Store GPS compass direction in the photos
Save all images for HDR mode

If enabled, when using HDR photo mode, the three base exposure images will be saved as well as the final HDR photo. Note this will make saving slower, especially if options like \"Stamp photos\" or Auto-level are also used.
A higher value means more sensitive to light (may not work on some devices)
If enabled, the screen won\'t switch off while the main Open Camera UI is active
Store GPS location data in the photos/videos
If set, the orientation of the device will be ignored, and the orientation of the photo/video will be with respect to the specified orientation

When recording video, the GUI will be locked to prevent accidentally stopping recording. Swipe the screen to unlock. Note that video recording will always stop if the app goes into background or the screen is blanked.
Force screen display to be at maximum brightness, rather than device default
Whether to save original images in noise reduction mode. Note this can make saving photos much slower.
Launch the Open Camera website in your browser
Pause the screen after taking a photo, with the option to share or delete the photo
How to choose the preview size
Set the image JPEG quality of saved photo images (default value is 90%%)
Whether to save in RAW (DNG) format
Specify mono or stereo for recording audio (stereo only supported on some devices)
Microphone to use for recording audio
If location data is enabled, only take photo/video if location data is available
Are you sure you want to reset all Open Camera settings to default?
Reset all Open Camera settings to default
Set the resolution of photos taken by the camera
Option to rotate the preview (won\'t affect resultant photos/videos)
Folder to save the photo/video files in
The prefix to use for the save filenames for photos
The prefix to use for the save filenames for videos
Whether to use local or UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) time for naming photos and videos
Optimise the photo for different scenes
Display the current device orientation angle on screen
Display the current battery level on screen
Display the compass direction of the device on screen
Display the current ISO level. In flash auto mode, a flash symbol will also indicate when flash will fire. (Requires Camera2 API.)
Show the icon for taking photos and recording videos. Useful if your device has a hardware shutter button and you\'d rather use that.
Display the current time on screen
Whether to display the popup \"toast\" messages
If enabled, Open Camera will still show above any lockscreen (you\'ll still have to unlock to access Settings, Gallery etc)
Show the -/+ buttons for zoom control
Show the slider for zoom control
Display the current camera zoom level on screen (when zoomed in)
Play a sound when taking a photo
Specify the format of the datestamp (if enabled)
Font color to use when stamping text onto photos
Font size to use when stamping text onto photos
Specify the format of the GPS stamp (if enabled)
Style to use when stamping text onto photos
Stamp photos with date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled
Specify the format of the timestamp (if enabled)
Whether to auto-focus when Open Camera is started. If you have the problem of flash turning on when starting, disable this option
Display a border on the display to indicate taking a photo
Stamp photos with a custom text
Display moving thumbnail animation when taking a photo
Beep when timer is counting down or for burst mode delay
Speak the countdown for timer or burst mode delay (from 60 seconds)
Set a timer for the camera
Take a photo just by touching or double-tapping the preview
Whether to have a left-handed or right-handed user interface
Enables Android 5\'s Camera2 API - offers extra features, but may not work properly on all devices (will cause a restart)
Whether to use Android 5\'s Storage Access Framework for saving photos and videos
Set the approximate bitrate of videos (higher means better quality, but takes up more disk space; may cause video recording to fail if bitrate not supported)
If enabled, flash will switch on/off when recording video (can be used to tell camera is still recording at a distance)
Set the frame rate (FPS) of videos (may be approx, not guaranteed to be achieved, and may cause video recording to fail if frame rate not supported)
Stop video recording if battery level is critically low. This helps reduce the risk of videos being corrupted if your device suddenly switches off due to running out of power.
The video recording will stop after the specified duration

The video recording will stop and/or restart (see option below) when the (approximate) maximum file size is reached. Note that almost all Android devices have a maximum file size for videos (typically around 2GB or 4GB), but this option allows setting a specific value
Whether to automatically restart when the maximum file size is reached (whether the device default max file size, or user specified)
If the video has stopped after hitting the maximum duration (if set), this option will make the video restart, up to the specified number of times
Video stabilization reduces the shaking due to the motion of the camera in both the preview and in recorded videos
Create a subtitles (.SRT) file storing date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled
Set behaviour for when volume keys are pressed
Choose a setting to adjust the white balance

DNG files contain the full uncompressed and unprocessed information from your camera.

Most gallery apps won't recognise DNG, instead they should be used with specialised apps like Snapseed or Lightroom.

Note that various processing options such as "Stamp photos" and "Auto-level" will only apply to the JPEG images, and not the DNG images.

DNG files take up a lot of space; a file explorer app may be useful for transferring or deleting them.

DNG files are only saved in Standard or DRO photo modes.
Unable to save to this folder
Screen is locked\nswipe the screen to unlock
Error, video file may be corrupted
Not enough free space to record video
